builder-mindset-story.text: The Old Way. You've learned to ask deep questions. You've learned to see data everywhere. But here's a secret most people don't know: You don't need years of coding to build websites and tools anymore.
The New Reality. With AI, everything changed. You describe what you want in plain English, and the AI builds it for you. No coding experience needed—just clear communication and creative ideas.
Step 1: Think It. Your superpower starts with imagination. What would be useful? What would be cool? What problem could you solve? The idea is the seed of everything.
Step 2: Describe It. Put your idea into words. The clearer and more specific you describe it, the better the AI understands. This is where your communication skills shine!
Step 3: AI Builds It. The AI takes your description and generates working code. It handles all the technical details—you just focus on what you want it to do.
Step 4: It's Live!. Your creation is real! Put it online, share the link, and say 'I made this.' You've gone from consumer to creator. Most people just use the internet—you build it!

art-of-building-story.text: Building is a Conversation. Building with AI is like having a conversation with a super-smart helper. You describe what you want, it creates it, you give feedback, it improves. Iterate until it's perfect!
Describe What You Want. Start by describing your vision clearly. What is it? What should it do? How should it look? The more specific you are, the better the first attempt will be.
Preview the Result. Save the file, open it in your browser, and see what AI created. Does it match your vision? What works? What doesn't? This is your feedback moment.
Ask for Changes. Don't like the colors? Want more features? Just ask! Tell the AI exactly what to change. It remembers your conversation and builds on previous work.
Keep Iterating. Great builders iterate. Each round gets you closer to your vision. Professional developers do this too—nobody gets it perfect on the first try!

clear-prompts-story.text: Description Quality Matters. The quality of what AI builds depends entirely on how well you describe it. Vague descriptions get vague results. Clear descriptions get exactly what you want.
Too Vague. Make me a website. That's too vague! What kind of website? What should it do? What should it look like? The AI has to guess—and it will probably guess wrong.
Say WHAT It Is. A quiz webpage about Grand Rapids history. Now the AI knows the type and topic. But we can be even more specific about features and style.
List the Features. Five multiple choice questions, show if answers are correct immediately, track the score, include a try-again button. Now AI knows exactly what functionality to build.
Describe the Style. Modern look, blue color scheme, clean design. With the type, features, and style all specified, AI creates something that matches your vision on the first try!
